intro: Pedicularis labradorica, commonly known as Labrador crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or tundra environments. Its leaves are basal and linear, while its stems are erect and branched. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies.
